methods.name: fetch

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to fetch.

methods.description: Makes a request to fetch a URL.

methods.name: fetch

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to fetch.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The optional JavaScript object specifying advanced parameters as defined below.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: The content type (defaults to 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'). Another example of content type is 'application/xml; charset=utf-8'.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: A JavaScript key/value map of HTTP headers for the request.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The HTTP method for the request: get, delete, patch, post, or put. The default is get.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The payload (that is, the POST body) for the request. Certain HTTP methods (for example, GET) do not accept a payload. It can be a string, a byte array, a blob, or a JavaScript object. A JavaScript object is interpreted as a map of form field names to values, where the values can be either strings or blobs.

parameters.name: useIntranet
parameters.description: Deprecated. This instructs fetch to resolve the specified URL within the intranet linked to your domain through (deprecated) SDC.

parameters.name: validateHttpsCertificates
parameters.description: If false the fetch ignores any invalid certificates for HTTPS requests. The default is true.

parameters.name: followRedirects
parameters.description: If false the fetch doesn't automatically follow HTTP redirects; it returns the original HTTP response. The default is true.

parameters.name: muteHttpExceptions
parameters.description: If true the fetch doesn't throw an exception if the response code indicates failure, and instead returns the HTTPResponse. The default is false.

parameters.name: escaping
parameters.description: If false reserved characters in the URL aren't escaped. The default is true.

methods.description: Makes a request to fetch a URL using optional advanced parameters.

properties.name: CLOCK
properties.description: The trigger fires once the time-driven event reaches a specific time.

properties.name: ON_OPEN
properties.description: The trigger fires once the user opens the Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms file.

properties.name: ON_EDIT
properties.description: The trigger fires once the user edits the Google Sheets file (for example, by entering a new value into a cell, which counts as an edit instead of a change).

properties.name: ON_FORM_SUBMIT
properties.description: The trigger fires once the user responds to a Google Form. This trigger is available either in the Google Form itself or in the Google Sheets file that the form sends its responses to.

properties.name: ON_CHANGE
properties.description: The trigger fires once the user changes the Google Sheets file (for example, by adding a row, which counts as a change instead of an edit).

properties.name: ON_EVENT_UPDATED
properties.description: The trigger fires once an event gets created, updated, or deleted on the specified Google Calendar.

properties.name: REQUIRED
properties.description: The user needs to authorize this script to use one or more services. In most cases, the script prompts the user for authorization the next time it runs; however, if the script is published as an add-on that uses installable triggers, the trigger runs the script without prompting for authorization but throws an exception if the script attempts to call the unauthorized service.

properties.name: NOT_REQUIRED
properties.description: The user has granted this script all the authorization it currently requires.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: A mode that does not allow access to any services that require authorization. This mode occurs when an add-on executes an onOpen(e) simple trigger, and the user has installed an add-on in a different document but the add-on has not been used in the current document.

properties.name: CUSTOM_FUNCTION
properties.description: A mode that allows access to a limited subset of services for use in custom spreadsheet functions. Some of these services — including read-only access to Spreadsheet service — normally require authorization, but are permitted without authorization when used in a custom function. Because custom functions do not include an event parameter, this value is never returned; it is documented only to demonstrate that custom functions run in their own authorization mode.

properties.name: LIMITED
properties.description: A mode that allows access to a limited subset of services. This mode occurs when an add-on or a script bound to a document executes an onOpen(e) or onEdit(e) simple trigger, except in the case described for NONE.

properties.name: FULL
properties.description: A mode that allows access to all services that require authorization. This mode occurs when an add-on or a script executes as the result of any trigger other than the cases described for LIMITED or NONE.

properties.name: APPS_MARKETPLACE_DOMAIN_ADD_ON
properties.description: Add-on was installed by the administrator for the user's domain.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: Script is not running as an add-on.

properties.name: WEB_STORE_ADD_ON
properties.description: Add-on was installed by the user from the Chrome Web Store.

methods.name: setDate

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The day of month to set. This timestamp is updated to represent a point in time within the specified day of month, with the year, month, hour, minute, and second the same as before, as interpreted in the local time zone. If the date was April 30, for example, and the date is set to 31, then it is treated as if it were on May 1, because April has only 30 days.

methods.description: For documentation of this method, see java.sql.Date#setDate(int).

methods.name: setMonth

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month to set. This timestamp is updated to represent a point in time within the specified month, with the year, date, hour, minute, and second the same as before, as interpreted in the local time zone. If the date was October 31, for example, and the month is set to June, then the new date is treated as if it were on July 1, because June has only 30 days.

parameters.description: The year value to set; the timestamp's year is set to this value plus 1900. properties.name: EMULATED
properties.description: A legacy sandbox mode that emulates ECMAScript 5 strict mode using only the features available in ECMAScript 3. This mode was the default prior to February 2014.   EMULATED was sunset as of December 10, 2015. All scripts attempting use EMULATED will now use IFRAME instead.

properties.name: IFRAME
properties.description: A sandbox mode that uses iframe sandboxing instead of the Caja sandbox technology used by the EMULATED and NATIVE modes. This mode is the default for new scripts as of November 12, 2015 and for all scripts as of July 6, 2016.  This mode imposes many fewer restrictions than the other sandbox modes and runs fastest, but does not work at all in certain older browsers, including Internet Explorer 9.

properties.name: NATIVE
properties.description: A sandbox mode that is built on top of ECMAScript 5 strict mode. A sandbox mode built on top of ECMAScript 5 strict mode. This mode was sunset as of July 6, 2016. All scripts now use IFRAME mode.

properties.name: VIDEO
properties.description: A video entry point for a conference. A conference can have zero or one VIDEO entry points.

properties.name: PHONE
properties.description: A phone entry point for a conference. A conference can have zero or more PHONE entry points.

properties.name: MORE
properties.description: A link to more information about entry points into a conference. A conference can have zero or one MORE entry points. A conference with only a MORE entry point is not valid.

properties.name: SIP
properties.description: A SIP entry point for a conference. A conference can have zero or one SIP entry points.

properties.name: UNKNOWN_FEATURE
properties.description: Do not use. Here only as a default value for compatibility reasons.

properties.name: TOLL
properties.description: Applies to PHONE entry point only. A call to a toll number is charged to the calling party. A number can't be toll and toll-free at the same time.

properties.name: TOLL_FREE
properties.description: Applies to PHONE entry point only. For the calling party, a call to a toll-free number is free of charge. A number can't be toll and toll-free at the same time.

properties.name: CHECK_BOX
properties.description: Checkbox input style. Default.

properties.name: RADIO_BUTTON
properties.description: Radio buton input style. At most one item in the group can be selected.

properties.name: DROPDOWN
properties.description: Dropdown menu selection input style.

properties.name: SWITCH
properties.description: Toggle-styled control for a switch widget. Default.

properties.name: CHECK_BOX
properties.description: Checkbox-styled control for a switch widget.

properties.name: IN_PLACE_INSERT
properties.description: Default. Update actions insert content at the current cursor position, replacing any selected content.

properties.name: INSERT_AT_START
properties.description: Update actions insert content at the start of message body.

properties.name: INSERT_AT_END
properties.description: Update actions insert content at the end of the message body. If an email signature is present, in Gmail on the web, the update action inserts after the user's signature. In the Gmail mobile app, the update action inserts before the user's signature.

properties.name: FULL_SIZE
properties.description: Open in a full window or tab. Default.

properties.name: OVERLAY
properties.description: Open as an overlay such as a pop-up.

properties.name: NOTHING
properties.description: Do nothing on close. Default.

properties.name: RELOAD
properties.description: Reloads the add-on on when the window closes.  If OpenAs.OVERLAY is also set, then the main card is blocked until the overlay window is closed and the add-on has finished reloading.

properties.name: RELOAD_ADD_ON
properties.description: Reload the add-on on closing the URL. This action differs from RELOAD in that it does not block the main card while showing an OpenAs.OVERLAY window.

properties.name: SPINNER
properties.description: Use a spinner indicator. Default.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: Do not use an indicator.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: No icon. Default.

properties.name: SQUARE
properties.description: No cropping. Default.

properties.name: CIRCLE
properties.description: Crop to a circle shape.

properties.name: START
properties.description: Align the widget to the start of the sentence side.

properties.name: CENTER
properties.description: Align the widget to the center.

properties.name: END
properties.description: Align the widget to the end of the sentence side.

properties.name: TEXT
properties.description: Normal text button with clear background. Default.

properties.name: FILLED
properties.description: Text button with colored background.

properties.name: TEXT_BELOW
properties.description: The title and subtitle are shown below the grid item's image.

properties.name: TEXT_ABOVE
properties.description: The title and subtitle are shown above the grid item's image.

properties.name: TEXT
properties.description: Indicates that the generated content is plain text. Default.

properties.name: MUTABLE_HTML
properties.description: Indicates that the generated content is formatted as HTML. The content can be edited after it is generated.

properties.name: IMMUTABLE_HTML
properties.description: Indicates that the generated content is formatted as HTML, but this content cannot be edited after it is generated.

properties.name: PEEK
properties.description: Show the card header at the bottom of add-on content over existing content.

properties.name: REPLACE
properties.description: Show the card by replacing existing content.

properties.name: WRAP
properties.description: Wrap lines that are longer than the cell width onto a new line. Single words that are longer than a line are wrapped at the character level.

properties.name: OVERFLOW
properties.description: Overflow lines into the next cell, so long as that cell is empty. If the next cell over is non-empty, this behaves the same as CLIP.

properties.name: CLIP
properties.description: Clip lines that are longer than the cell width.

properties.name: DUPLICATE_COLUMN_NAMES
properties.description: The data execution returns duplicate column names. Please update the data source specification.

properties.name: INTERRUPTED
properties.description: The data execution is interrupted. Please refresh later.

properties.name: OTHER

properties.description: The data execution returns values that exceed the maximum characters allowed in a single cell. Please update the data source specification.

methods.name: moveColumns

parameters.name: columnSpec
parameters.description: A range spanning the columns that should be moved.

parameters.name: destinationIndex
parameters.description: The index that the columns should be moved to. Note that this index is based on the coordinates before the columns are moved. Existing data is shifted right to make room for the moved columns while the source columns are removed from the grid. Therefore, the data may end up at a different index than originally specified.

methods.description: Moves the columns selected by the given range to the position indicated by the destinationIndex.

methods.name: moveRows

parameters.name: rowSpec
parameters.description: A range spanning the rows that should be moved.

parameters.name: destinationIndex

properties.description: Resizes the shape to fit the text.

properties.name: NORMAL
properties.description: The cell is not merged.

properties.name: HEAD
properties.description: The cell is merged and it is the head (i.e. upper left) cell within the merged set of cells.  As an example, assume the following table.   ------------------- |(0,0)|(0,1)|(0,2)| -------------------  If the first two cells are merged to form the following table, cell (0,0) is the head cell and (0,1) is a merged cell.  ------------------- |(0,0)      |(0,2)| -------------------.

properties.name: MERGED
properties.description: The cell is merged but is not the head (i.e. upper left) cell.  As an example, assume the following table.   ------------------- |(0,0)|(0,1)|(0,2)| -------------------  If the first two cells are merged to form the following table, cell (0,0) is the head cell and (0,1) is a merged cell.  ------------------- |(0,0)      |(0,2)| -------------------.

properties.name: UNSUPPORTED
properties.description: An auto text type that is not supported.

properties.name: SLIDE_NUMBER
properties.description: A slide number.

properties.name: UNSUPPORTED
properties.description: A content alignment that is not supported.

properties.name: TOP
properties.description: Aligns the content to the top of the content holder. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_TextAnchoringType 't'.

properties.name: MIDDLE
properties.description: Aligns the content to the middle of the content holder. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_TextAnchoringType 'ctr'.

properties.name: BOTTOM
properties.description: Aligns the content to the bottom of the content holder. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_TextAnchoringType 'b'.

properties.name: UNSUPPORTED
properties.description: A dash style that is not supported.

properties.name: SOLID
properties.description: Solid line. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_PresetLineDashVal value 'solid'. This is the default dash style.

properties.name: DOT
properties.description: Dotted line. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_PresetLineDashVal value 'dot'.

properties.name: DASH
properties.description: Dashed line. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_PresetLineDashVal value 'dash'.

properties.name: DASH_DOT
properties.description: Alternating dashes and dots. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_PresetLineDashVal value 'dashDot'.

properties.name: LONG_DASH
properties.description: Line with large dashes. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_PresetLineDashVal value 'lgDash'.

properties.name: LONG_DASH_DOT
properties.description: Alternating large dashes and dots. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_PresetLineDashVal value 'lgDashDot'.

properties.name: UNSUPPORTED
properties.description: An arrow style that is not supported.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: No arrow.

properties.name: STEALTH_ARROW
properties.description: Arrow with notched back. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_LineEndType value 'stealth'.

properties.name: FILL_ARROW
properties.description: Filled arrow. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_LineEndType value 'triangle'.

properties.name: FILL_CIRCLE
properties.description: Filled circle. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_LineEndType value 'oval'.

properties.name: FILL_SQUARE
properties.description: Filled square.

properties.name: FILL_DIAMOND
properties.description: Filled diamond. Corresponds to ECMA-376 ST_LineEndType value 'diamond'.

properties.name: OPEN_ARROW
properties.description: Hollow arrow.

properties.name: OPEN_CIRCLE
properties.description: Hollow circle.

properties.name: OPEN_SQUARE
properties.description: Hollow square.

properties.name: OPEN_DIAMOND
properties.description: Hollow diamond.

properties.description: Align to the vertical center.

methods.name: clear

parameters.name: startOffset
parameters.description: The number of characters past the start index of the current text range used to determine the inclusive start index of the range to clear. The start offset must be equal to or greater than 0 and less than or equal to endOffset. startOffset must also be less than the length of the current range.

parameters.name: endOffset
parameters.description: The number of characters past the start index of the current text range used to determine the exclusive end index of the range to clear. The endOffset must be equal to or greater than startOffset. endOffset must also be less than or equal to the length of the current range.

properties.name: TRANSIT
properties.description: Transit directions via public transit routes (where available). This mode requires that you set either the departure or arrival time.  // Log all available data for a public-transit trip. var directions = Maps.newDirectionFinder() .setOrigin('The Cloisters, New York, NY') .setDestination('JFK airport, New York, NY') .setMode(Maps.DirectionFinder.Mode.TRANSIT) .setDepart(new Date()) .getDirections(); var route = directions.routes[0]; Logger.log(route);.

properties.name: SPREADSHEET
properties.description: A Google Sheets spreadsheet as a destination for form responses.

properties.name: CHECKBOX
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to select one or more checkboxes, as well as an optional "other" field.

properties.name: CHECKBOX_GRID
properties.description: A question item, presented as a grid of columns and rows, that allows the respondent to select multiple choices per row from a sequence of checkboxes.

properties.name: DATE
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date.

properties.name: DATETIME
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a date and time.

properties.name: DURATION
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a length of time.

properties.name: GRID
properties.description: A question item, presented as a grid of columns and rows, that allows the respondent to select one choice per row from a sequence of radio buttons.

properties.name: IMAGE
properties.description: A layout item that displays an image.

properties.name: LIST
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a drop-down list.

properties.name: MULTIPLE_CHOICE
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to select one choice from a list of radio buttons or an optional "other" field.

properties.name: PAGE_BREAK
properties.description: A layout item that marks the start of a page.

properties.name: PARAGRAPH_TEXT
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to enter a block of text.

properties.name: SCALE
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to choose one option from a numbered sequence of radio buttons.

properties.name: SECTION_HEADER
properties.description: A layout item that visually indicates the start of a section.

properties.name: TEXT
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to enter a single line of text.

properties.name: TIME
properties.description: A question item that allows the respondent to indicate a time of day.

properties.name: VIDEO
properties.description: A layout item that displays a YouTube video.

properties.name: LEFT
properties.description: Align the image to the left side of the form.

properties.name: CENTER
properties.description: Align the image to the center of the form.

properties.name: RIGHT
properties.description: Align the image to the right side of the form.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A JavaScript object that specifies advanced parameters, as listed below.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: An array of files to send with the email.

parameters.name: bcc
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of email addresses to BCC.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of email addresses to CC.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The address that the email should be sent from, which must be one of the values returned by GmailApp.getAliases().

parameters.name: htmlBody
parameters.description: If set, devices capable of rendering HTML will use it instead of the required body argument; you can add an optional inlineImages field in HTML body if you have inlined images for your email.

parameters.name: inlineImages
parameters.description: A JavaScript object containing a mapping from image key (String) to image data (BlobSource); this assumes that the htmlBody parameter is used and contains references to these images in the format .

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the sender of the email (default: the user's name).

parameters.name: replyTo
parameters.description: An email address to use as the default reply-to address (default: the user's email address).

properties.name: CORRECT
properties.description: Feedback that is automatically displayed to respondents for a question answered correctly. Correct feedback can only be attached to a question type that supports autograding (e.g. radio, checkbox, select).

properties.name: INCORRECT
properties.description: Feedback that is automatically displayed to respondents for a question answered incorrectly. Incorrect feedback can only be attached to a question type that supports autograding (e.g. radio, checkbox, select).

properties.name: GENERAL
properties.description: Feedback that is automatically displayed to respondents when they submit their response. General feedback can only be attached to question types that do not support auto-grading, but are gradeable (ie everything but grid).

properties.name: ANYONE
properties.description: Anyone on the Internet can find and access. No sign-in required.  Domain administrators can prohibit this setting for users of a Google Workspace domain. If the setting is disabled, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: ANYONE_WITH_LINK
properties.description: Anyone who has the link can access. No sign-in required.  Domain administrators can prohibit this setting for users of a Google Workspace domain. If the setting is disabled, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: DOMAIN
properties.description: People in your domain can find and access. Sign-in required.  This setting is available only for users of a Google Workspace domain. For other types of Google accounts, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: DOMAIN_WITH_LINK
properties.description: People in your domain who have the link can access. Sign-in required.  This setting is available only for users of a Google Workspace domain. For other types of Google accounts, passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: PRIVATE
properties.description: Only people explicitly granted permission can access. Sign-in required.

properties.name: VIEW
properties.description: Users who can access the file or folder are able only to view it or copy it. Passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception if the type of file does not support it.

properties.name: EDIT
properties.description: Users who can access the file or folder are able to edit it. Unless File.setShareableByEditors(shareable) is set to false, users can also change the sharing settings. Passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception if the type of file does not support it.

properties.name: COMMENT
properties.description: Users who can access the file or folder are able only to view it, copy it, or comment on it. Passing this value to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception if the type of file does not support it.

properties.name: OWNER
properties.description: The user owns the file or folder. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: ORGANIZER
properties.description: Users who can organize files and folders within a shared drive. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: FILE_ORGANIZER
properties.description: Users who can edit, trash, and move content within a shared drive. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: The user does not have any permissions for the file or folder. This value can be returned, but passing it to File.setSharing(accessType, permissionType) throws an exception unless it is set in combination with Access.ANYONE.

properties.name: ABOVE_TEXT
properties.description: The image is positioned above the text.

properties.name: BREAK_BOTH
properties.description: The image breaks the text on the left and right.

properties.name: BREAK_LEFT
properties.description: The image breaks the text on the left.

properties.name: BREAK_RIGHT
properties.description: The image breaks the text on the right.

properties.name: WRAP_TEXT
properties.description: The image is wrapped by text.

methods.description: Sets the description of the calendar.

methods.name: setHidden

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: True to hide the calendar in the user interface; false to show it.

methods.description: Sets whether the calendar is visible in the user interface.

methods.name: setName

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name.

methods.description: Sets the name of the calendar.

methods.name: setSelected

parameters.name: selected
parameters.description: True to show the calendar's events in the user interface; false to hide them.

methods.description: Sets whether the calendar's events are displayed in the user interface.

methods.name: setTimeZone

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone, specified in "long" format (e.g., "America/New_York", as listed by Joda.org).

methods.description: Sets the time zone of the calendar.

methods.name: unsubscribeFromCalendar
methods.description: Unsubscribes the user from the calendar.
